alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 02 at 4:42AM CDT until August 02 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Missouri, including the following county, Franklin. * WHEN...Until 745 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 442 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Union, Sullivan, St. Clair, Gerald, Parkway, Miramiguoa Park, Beaufort, Lonedell, Leslie, Stanton, Noser Mill, Piney Park, Lyon, Moselle and Japan.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
